intro: Banisterodes ellipticum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed banister, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant features slender, upright stems with opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom in spring. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands.
